tool_description: OpenFEMA is an authoritative source for FEMA's public data, which has been released as part of the Open Government Initiative. The OpenFEMA API provides the public with free, read-only access to FEMA datasets that include information on public assistance funded projects, public assistance applicants, hazard mitigation grants, and disaster declarations. The API can also be used to retrieve its own documentation and a listing of the available datasets.
name: OpenFEMA
title: OpenFEMA

api_list.name: Get Entity
api_list.description: You can find a full list of supported Entities at http://www.fema.gov/data-feeds#APIs

required_parameters.name: entity
required_parameters.description: This corresponds to the name of the entity set you are requesting. The entity names can be found in the list of released data sets.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-openfema.p.rapidapi.com/DisasterDeclarationsSummaries"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-openfema.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://community-openfema.p.rapidapi.com/{entity}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-openfema.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Entity by ID
api_list.description: Retrieves a specific record identified by its ID field (_id)

required_parameters.name: entity
required_parameters.description: This corresponds to the name of the entity set you are requesting. The entity names can be found in the list of released data sets.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: This is a _id value of a previously identified record in an entity

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-openfema.p.rapidapi.com/DisasterDeclarationsSummaries/52f91785341d630a05000002"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-openfema.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://community-openfema.p.rapidapi.com/{entity}/{id}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-openfema.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
